entry.title: safe-json-parse
entry.content:
safe-json-parse

Parse JSON safely without throwing.

Sweet, simple and effictive module for parsing JSON safely :)

Get it: npm install safe-json-parse --save

Sample usage:

With callback:

```js

var sf = require('safe-json-parse');

sf("{}", function (err, json) {console.log(err,json);}); null {}

sf("meow", function (err, json) {console.log(err,json);}); [SyntaxError: Unexpected token m] undefined

```

As Tuples:

```js

var sf = require('safe-json-parse/tuple'); sf({}) [ [SyntaxError: Unexpected token o], undefined ] sf("{}") [ null, {} ] ```

GIF FTW!

Thanks to Raynos for helping us with safely parsing JSONs ;)
